isis.stitle: TSI 02-12-01 - In Chassis Cleaning Procedure for Vehicle Cooling Package for All International® Models Except 3000RE Bus (Note: For 3000RE Model Refer to TSI-98-12-18)

subjectgroup.subject: In Chassis Cleaning Procedure for Vehicle Cooling Package for All International® Models Except 3000RE Bus (Note: For 3000RE Model Refer to TSI-98-12-18)

geninfo.para: The performance and life of heat exchangers are significantly affected by the proper scheduled maintenance of the system. If an engine overheats or low engine power occurs, visually inspect the radiator core and charge air cooler fins for signs of dirt or debris. Fluid leaks greater than seepage can cause the charge air cooler or radiator fin clogging.

note.para: Engine compartment fluid leaks should be repaired as soon as possible to prevent charge air cooler clogging.

geninfo.para: The following procedure is recommended as part of the scheduled maintenance program to ensure road dirt and debris are removed from the cooling systems to insure optimum performance.

entry.para: Deck Sprayer with Flexible Extension Wand and Fan Tip
Garden Hose with Pistol Grip Nozzle

para.emph: Side by Side or Over-Under Charge Air Cooler and Radiator Assemblies

step1.para: If the vehicle is equipped with Air Conditioning, pressure wash or steam clean the condensor from the front of the vehicle. Then move the AC condensor out of position without disconnecting the refrigeration lines.
Mix Simple Green cleaner in a 50/50 mixture with water in the sprayer tank.

Spray the front of the charge air cooler and radiator with the Simple Green cleaning solution. Allow the cleaning solution to soak 20 to 30 minutes. Additional cleaning solution may be applied to heavily plugged areas.

caution.para: Do not spray the charge air cooler or radiator fins at an angle as fin damage may occur and reduce cooling efficiency. Use caution and maintain distance from the cooling module with the pressure washer or steam cleaner to prevent cooling module fin damage.

step1.para: After the soak period, pressure wash or steam clean the cooling package from the front of the vehicle. Thoroughly clean each row of fins slowly vertically then horizontally.

Rinse the cooling module with the garden hose and nozzle from the front side. Spray water at a 45 degree angle or less to dislodge and rinse debris from the charge air cooler. Inspect the fins with the technicians mirror and a flashlight to insure adequate cleaning. If areas were missed, spot clean those areas following the above procedure Steps.

para.emph: Front to Back Charge Air Cooler and Radiator Assemblies

step1.para: If the vehicle is equipped with air conditioning, pressure wash or steam clean the condensor from the front of the vehicle. Then move the AC condensor out of position without disconnecting the refrigeration lines.
Remove the CAC unit from the vehicle and plug the CAC hoses and CAC inlets to prevent debris from entering.
Mix Simple Green cleaner in a 50/50 mixture with water in the sprayer tank.

Spray the front of the charge air cooler and radiator with Simple Green cleaning solution. Allow the cleaning solution to soak 20 to 30 minutes. Additional cleaning solution may be applied to heavily plugged areas.

caution.para: Do not spray the charge air cooler or radiator fins at an angle as fin damage may occur and reduce cooling efficiency. Use caution and maintain distance from the cooling module with the pressure washer or steam cleaner to prevent cooling module fin damage.

step1.para: After the soak period, pressure wash or steam clean the charge air cooler and radiator from the front of the vehicle. Thoroughly clean each row of fins slowly vertically then horizontally.

Rinse the charge air cooler and radiator with the garden hose and nozzle from the front side. Spray water at a 45 degree angle or less to dislodge and rinse debris from the cooling module cores. Inspect the fins with the technicians mirror and the flashlight to insure adequate cleaning. If areas were missed, spot clean those areas following the above procedure Steps.
Reinstall the CAC unit and the AC condensor.
